text: it's an area that's not easily accessed
you heard from the information minister
as well that while they have phone lines
operational in the capital they're
having some difficulty in actually
communicating with some of these areas
now Nepal of course is a mountainous
country which immediately gives you a
sense of how difficult some parts of the
country is to access even at the best of
times for instance often you the only
way to get across is by using small
aircraft and and if there's bad weather
those aircraft have no way of landing
the earthquake itself could be felt not
just in Nepal but actually across the
entire region I mean sitting here in
Delhi are we we could feel the tremors
here for which lasted for well over a
minute the walls were shaking people in
high buildings that actually rushed out
and panic before they felt it was safe
to go back in again but the authorities
in both countries at the moment simply
assessing the damage and in Nepal trying
to get a sense really of the scale of
the damage but we are already getting a
sense that eventually Nepal is going to
have to look for some kind of
international assistance
